conclusion: Principles of reflection and total reflection in optics are needed.
Light incident on a boundary will be reflected or refracted.
Total reflection occurs when the angle of incidence equals the angle of reflection.
Light is incident from air to a transparent medium at point A on the sphere.
Concept of total reflection: angle of incidence equals angle of reflection.
Angle of incidence \( \theta_i \) is equal to angle of reflection \( \theta_r \).
Since \( \theta_i = I \), it follows that \( \theta_r = I \).
Light will be totally reflected when it exits the sphere.
Conditions for total reflection are met.
